sourceDesc.p: This is a born-digital edition created through custom XSLT from a OmniOutliner 3 XML file on 3 March 2014.

refsDecl.tei:p: Bibliographic notes are marked with the ref element. This element carries the attribute type identifying the source of the reference – usually a reference managing software.ref type="SenteCitationID" identifies Sente as the reference manager. The target attribute contains the placeholder tag used by the software identified in type to refer to an individual reference or a group of references.

revisionDesc.change: Changed all note with type='SenteCitationID' to ref elements
corrected the faulty attribute values of corresp on note elements: the internal spaces in Sente IDs were replaced with "+" and the separating ";" has been replaced with whitespaces
Created by automatic conversion from OmniOutliner

table.head: Censorship of Newspapers in Beirut and Damascus, 1877-1914

tei:row.cell: Comment
Aḥmad ʿIzzat Bey and Aḥmad ʿArafī Bey obtain the official permit to publish a weekly (Wednesday) in Damascus.
An offensive expression
No reasons given. Lisān's gap in publication between #52 (15 Apr) and #53 (13 May)
unkown reasons
Adīb Naẓmī and Ṭāhir Maghribī Efendi obtained the permit to publish a weekly political and literary paper in Damascus and to open a printing press for this purpose
Incitement to tax evasion and a false report
Amīn Efendi Tarakci obtained the permit to publish a weekly, Ottoman and Arabic speaking newspaper under the title of al-Shām in Damascus
permit to resume its publication in Arabic and Ottoman after being shut down for some months

tei:cell.tei:ref: Lisān 4 Aug 1879 (#181), Thamarāt 4 Aug 1879 (#240), Muqtaṭaf, 4(4), Sep 1879:116

tei:row.cell: Complaints about its contents
False news and rumors
Harmful and contradictory news
No reasons given. Lisān's gap of publication of 3 numbers at some point between 23 Dec and 13 Jan.
Ministry of the Interior sent instructions to ban all reports on the death of Sultan ʿAbdulaziz
Inciting religious fanaticism
False news about the government of Lebanon
False news about the government of Lebanon
Prejudiced report on Lebanon
Insult to the sultan's consort in its #21 of 22 Dhu II 1298 (15 Nov 1881)
No reason provided
Insult to the sultan
Personal invective
Rumors from Egypt
insulting the Druze community in #123
For news from Alexandria

tei:cell.tei:ref: Bashīr 20 Jul 1882 (#619), Lisān 24 Jul 1882 (#487), Thamarāt 24 Jul 1882 (#391)

tei:row.cell: For news from Alexandria
False news about evens in Alexandria

tei:cell.tei:ref: Bashīr 20 Jul 1882 (#619), Thamarāt 24 Jul 1882 (#391), Lisān 24 Jul 1882 (#487)

tei:row.cell: insulting the Druze community, repeated punishment, imperial order
Personal invective
false reports on the cordon sanitaire around Beirut in #83
False news from Lebanon
False and exaggerated news about Lebanon
Upsetting news. over article in #122
For a report on the Shūf
For a report on the Shūf
Lies about Midḥat Pasha and ʿAbdul ʿAzīz

tei:cell.tei:ref: MECA GB165-0086, Dickson Journal 1882-1885, Damascus, entry of 5 Jun 1884, Ḥadīqat 19 Jun 1884 (#1346), Lisān 19 Jun 1884 (#685), Thamarāt 23 Jun 1884 (#484)

tei:row.cell: For al-Bashīr's number on the occasion of the Sultan's birthday
A controversy about Voltaire involving personal invective and incitement to public disturbances
A controversy about Voltaire involving personal invective and incitement to public disturbances
Najīb Efendi al-Bustānī received the permit to resume publication two months after the death of Salīm al-Bustānī
Najīb Efendi al-Bustānī received the permit to resume publication two months after the death of Salīm al-Bustānī
orders to destroy all newspapers from Egypt upon arrival

tei:cell.tei:ref: PRO FO 195/1480 Beirut 40, Eldridge to Wyndham, 10 Dec 1884

tei:row.cell: for news from Egypt
for news from Egypt
For publishing certain comments on the Mutaṣarrif of Lebanon
For publishing certain comments on the Mutaṣarrif of Lebanon
False reports of disturbances in Damascus on 19 Dhu II 1302 (23 Sep 1885)
False reports about government actions
Banned from publication for one month for reports on the Tzar's journey in #928 of 13 Jan 1887
Disturbing and harmful political news
False reports on the Anglo-Turkish talks.
Untrue reports on the Anglo-Turkish talks. Prohibition to quote from foreign newspapers
prohibition to quote from foreign newspapers
False news that incited the people to riot
Resumed publication
Permit issued for an Arabic, Ottoman, and French speaking newspaper in Damascus
Excitement of religious controversy. For #915 [Cioeta wrongly noted 515], probably banned for a month as there are only 26 numbers for the 7 months between mid-Mar and mid-Oct

Ṭāhir Efendi, former director of education, obtained the permit to publish an Ottoman, Arabic, and French-speaking newspaper in Damascus and Syria and to open a printing press under the title of Riyāḥāt al-Afkār

tei:cell.tei:ref: BOA DH Mkt 1494/15, 14 Mar 1888, BOA DH Mkt 1500/13, 11 Apr 1888

tei:row.cell: Offending the Sultan. Gap of publication between #968 (11 May) and #969 (8 Jun)
Failure to print the necessary titles and praises with the Sultan's name

Harming the public interest in #1160 of 6 May (thrown out of court, 9 Sep 1889). The first number after the ban speaks of 2 months only (between #1168 and #1169), but does not elaborate on the reasons
Publishing a forbidden expression
Warning to comply with censorship. Orders issued to the post to not deliver copies to the subscribers without prior compliance

For not having an irāde for publication and printing a telegram in #46 that was similarly reproduced by Lisān al-Ḥāl and others without objections from the censor. After eight months the paper got a new permit as a religious newspaper, henceforth prohibiting any political news
prohibition of import of the Armenian paper Sur Hintak from the USA into the Ottoman Empire
official permit to resume publication
publication of the paper banned indefinitely
Khālid Efendi from Kars obtained the permit to publish a bi-lingual Ottoman Arabic newspaper under the title Ruḥta al-Shām in Damascus

tei:cell.tei:ref: BOA DH Mkt 1718/21, 16 Apr 1890, BOA DH Mkt 1727/69, 30 May 1890

tei:row.cell: concession to publish a newspaper in Ottoman and Arabic under the title Rawḍat al-Shām is granted to Khālid Efendi al-Qārislī
the Ministry of the Interior issued an indefinite ban against the paper. Missing from the AUB collection, but the numbering indicates a ban of 5 months prior to March 1892
The Ministry of the Interior issued a permit to resume publication, which began on 24 October. No reason given.
Permit for the newspaper al-Shām, to be published in Damascus by Muṣṭafā Wāṣif Efendi
announcing the publication of the new newspaper al-Shām. Muṣṭafā Wāṣif is the proprietor and Adīb Naẓmī the editor and director.
2 months' gap in publication which is not commented on.
Violation of the censor's warning. Gap of publication between #1045 (5 Oct) and #1046 (9 Nov), or #1046 (12 Oct.) and #1047 (16 Nov)
A false news report
Printing a deleted expression
the owner of the librairie universelle Amīn Efendi al-Khūrī obtained the concession to publish Kawkab al-Sharq in Beirut
Printing something not in the draft copy
Violation of the censor's warning
Violation of the censor's warning
Violation of the censor's warning
Publication of two sentences not in the draft copy
Violation of the censor's warning
False news
False news
False news
Permit to recommence publication
For errors, perhaps because of a slip of the pen
No reason given
Publishing deleted material
Publishing deleted material
Permit granted under the condition that the proprietor will never again violate the law
Publication of uncensored issue
No reason given
After 40 days al-Arz resumed publication
Publishing uncensored articles
Publishing announcements not permitted by the terms of its license
Publishing announcements not permitted by the terms of its license
Publishing announcements not permitted by the terms of its license
Publishing uncensored material, changing words and substituting sentences in the approved draft
Publishing deleted articles, starting forbidden controversies
General warning prohibiting the publication of uncensored articles and altering words in approved articles
Permit for Ḥawādis̱-i Müḳtebese to be published in Damascus granted to Muṣṭafā Wāṣif Efendi. Publication interval not specified
Jirjī Efendi Matti from Acre, teacher at the Greek Orthodox school in Damascus, obtained the imperial permit to publish a fortnightly scientific journal in Damascus.

tei:cell.tei:ref: BOA MF Mkt 440/10, 25 Mar 1899, Bashīr 20 Nov 1899 (#1411)

tei:row.cell: Violating the censor's warning
Publication of uncensored material
repeated publishing of uncensored material by al-Miṣbāḥ or any other paper will be punished with ban

Permit for resuming publication
Violation of the basic principle of the Press Law
Violation of the basic principle of the Press Law by publishing uncensored materials
Violation of the basic principle of the Press Law by publishing uncensored materials
Violation of the basic principle of the Press Law

Violation of the basic principle of the Press Law.
after a long absence, al-Miṣbāḥ recommenced publication.
Violation of the basic principle of the Press Law
Violation of the basic principle of the Press Law.
Violation of the basic principle of the Press Law

Violation of the basic principle of the Press Law
No reason given
No reason given
Publication of an article which violated the principles of the Press Law
first issue after a ban of 4 months
Violation of the basic principle of the Press Law
Violation of the basic principle of the Press Law
Violation of the basic principle of the Press Law
Publication of articles which violated the basic principle of the Press Law
the permit depends on henceforth complying with the bases, communiqués, and instructions of censorship (murāqaba)
Publication of articles which violated the basic principle of the Press Law

Publication of articles which violated the basic principle of the Press Law. publication gap of ten days, between #4446 (6 Nov) and #4447 (15 Nov). Henceforth they have to comply with the basic principles [of the press law].
Henceforth they have to comply with the basic principles [of the press law]
Disregarding the censor's warning
Publication of articles without authorisation
Violation of the basic principles of censorship (uṣūl al-murāqaba)
Violation of the basic principles of censorship (uṣūl al-murāqaba)
Violation of the basic principles of censorship (uṣūl al-murāqaba)
Publication of articles prohibited by the censors for unnamed reasons
Violating the laws
permit to resume publication
Violation of the basic principles of censorship (uṣūl al-murāqaba)
Publication of uncensored phrases. Immediate and indefinite ban from today onwards
Publication of uncensored phrases
For an unnamed reason. Gap in publication between #1500 (14 Nov) and #1501 (27 Feb)
Permit for resuming publication after one month of suspension (since 7 Ram 1322 [15 Nov 1904])
For an unnamed reason
Thamarāt resumed publication after it received an imperial permit.
Permit to resume publication
For an unnamed reason. Corresponding gap of a total of 12 weeks at some point between #4741 (23 Dec 1904) and #4883 (1 Sep 1905).
Mistakes resulting from careless editing. Repetition of the offence will cause suspension
Permit was given to publish the newspaper Mawārid al-Ḥikma in Damascus
Violation of the basic principle of the Press Law. al-Maḥabba resumed publication after a month
Disregarding the censor's warning in #1504
ʿAbd al-Qādir Badrān Efendi obtained the permit to publish the weekly newspaper Mawārid al-Ḥikma in Damascus.
Nāṣīf Bey obtained a permit for the Arabic-speaking weekly al-ʿAṣr al-Jadīd in Damascus
Ḥayrī Bey, graduate of the teachers' college, obtained the permit to publish the Turkish-speaking daily newspaper Tekemmül
Muḥammad Ḥayrī Efendi Shabīb zade obtained the permit to publish a newspaper under the title of Dimashq
daily published in Beirut by Iskandar Efendi Khūrī and Khalīl Efendi Zayniyah
ʿAbd al-Qāḍīr Efendi Qabbānī announced that he will discontinue his newspaper after 35 years
Thrice a week.

Muḥammad Mīdānī Efendi did what was necessary to obtain a permit for publishing an Arabic-speaking newspaper in Damascus under the title of Kashf al-Ḥijāb. He did so in compliance with the law on printing presses, which is enforced by the ministry of gendarmerie
In compliance with the Vali of Syria, Muḥammad Kurd ʿAlī Efendi from Damascus obtained the permit to open a printing press and to publish a daily newspaper under the title of al-Muqtabas
Muḥammad Shākir, graduate of the Mekteb-i Mülkiye, and Fāris Khūri, graduate of the AUB, obtained the permit to publish a daily newspaper under the title of al-Band in Damascus
Daily in Damascus by Muḥammad Kurd ʿAlī
New weekly published in Beirut by Jirjī Efendi Shāḥin ʿAṭiyya
The permit to publish a newspaper was sent to Ṣāliḥ Efendi, municipal doctor and member of the medical association in Damascus
Daily, published by ʿAbd al-Ghannī al-ʿUraysī in Beirut
ʿAbdullah Efendi from Damascus obtained the permit to open a printing press (al-Ḥikma) and to publish two newspapers, al-Ḥikma and al-Rafīq, in his hometown
biweekly in Beirut

The owner of the concession for the al-Ṣalāḥ printing press in Damascus, Ḥabīb Barhūm Efendi, obtained the permit for an Ottoman and Arabic speaking newspaper under the title al-Sharq after he had handed in all the required stuff
ʿAbd al-Qādir Khaṭīb zade from Damascus obtained the permit to publish the weekly newspaper Faṣl a-Khiṭāb and to open the al-Maṭbaʿa al-ʿUmūmiyya printing press
Adīb Efendi Adabī zade obtained the permit to publish an Ottoman and Arabic speaking daily newspaper under the title of al-Nāqid al-Sūrī, which he had applied for
Numerous raids of its offices in connection with their opposition to the new press law
For publishing a treasonous article

tei:cell.tei:ref: Lisān 17 Sep 1909 (#6123), PRO FO 618/3 Damascus Draft 50, Devey to Lowther, Quarterly Report, 4 Oct 1909, Lisān 8 Oct 1909 (#6141), PRO FO 618/3 Damascus Draft 1, Devey to Lowther, Quarterly Report, 2 Jan 1910

tei:row.cell: Trial of the publisher for charges levelled by the municipality
Aḥmad Kurd ʿAlī obtained the permit to publish the daily al-Umma in Damascus. Continuing from al-Muqtabas.
first number of the daily al-Sharq arrived from Damascus.
After Muḥammad Kurd ʿAlī was cleared from the alleged treason, all al-Umma reverted back to its old name al-Muqtabas.
Resumed publication with 3 issues per week
published on Sat and Tue, owner is the teacher Shaykh Aḥmad al-ʿAṭṭār, editor is Adīb Efendi Naẓmī
New bi-lingual in Damascus, published thrice per week

row.cell: For publishing a qaṣīda by Shaykh Ibrāhīm al-Uskūbī

tei:row.cell: Paper closed down, reappeared as Ṣadā al-Mufīd within a few days.
continuing from al-Mufīd
Paper closed down, reappeared as Lisān al-ʿArab within a few days.
continuing from Ṣadā al-Mufīd
Paper closed down, reappeared as al-Fatā al-ʿArabī within a few days.
continuing from Lisān al-ʿArab
Ceased publication for a week and was continued as al-Qabas.
100 issues of al-Qabas continued al-Muqtabas' counting
Paper closed down, reappeared as Fatā al-ʿArab
continuing from al-Fatā al-ʿArabī
Banned and offices raided
Banned and offices raided
Resumed publication under the old name

div.head: Legend
div.p: The table is based on the table of suspensions, bans, and warnings provided by Cioeta, "Ottoman Censorship," 1979:182-185, which covered the years 1878-1908. I augmented his data with my readings, checked for corresponding gaps in publication when possible, corrected the dating, and added information on the years 1908-1914.
div.note: 1 Dates provide the date of the warning, if known. Otherwise they represent the date of publication for the periodical they were printed in. The dates are always different from Cioeta's as he confused the Ottoman fiscal (mālī) or Julian calendars for Gregorian reckoning.
2 BI: Ban on import; P: Permit or first publication; PR: Permit to resume publication; RP: Resumed publication; S: Suspension (taʿṭīl); W: Warning (ikhṭar)
5 Sources abbreviated as "TF" (Thamarāt al-Funūn) and "Iq" (al-Iqbāl) were solely provided by Cioeta

6 Cioeta sometimes chose to present the officially designated period of suspension, while on other occasions, he presented the actual period of suspension. Here, I generally opted for the officially decreed period of suspension.
